content.user_title: Add persistent memory to AI agents
content.value_statement: AI agents struggle to remember past conversations and learn from interactions. This skill provides AgentDB patterns for session memory, long-term storage, and pattern learning so agents maintain context across sessions and improve over time.
actual_capabilities: Initialize AgentDB vector database with custom dimensions
Store and retrieve session memory for conversation context
Implement long-term memory for persistent facts and preferences
Create learning plugins with 9 reinforcement learning algorithms
Consolidate and optimize memories by importance and relevance
Migrate from legacy ReasoningBank to AgentDB
limitations: Does not include AgentDB runtime implementation
No built-in authentication or access controls
Memory patterns require separate vector database setup

best_practices: Enable quantization (binary or scalar) to reduce memory footprint by 4-32x
Use in-memory database for testing before deploying persistent storage
Train learning models regularly to improve pattern recognition accuracy
anti_patterns: Storing all memories without consolidation can cause performance degradation
Using high-dimensional vectors without quantization increases storage costs
Neglecting cache configuration leads to slower retrieval times

faq.question: Is AgentDB compatible with other AI tools?
faq.answer: AgentDB integrates with Claude Code via MCP server and works with any tool supporting the Agentic Flow framework.

faq.question: What are the performance benchmarks?
faq.answer: Vector search is under 100 microseconds with HNSW indexing. Pattern retrieval is under 1 millisecond with caching.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing agents?
faq.answer: Use the createAgentDBAdapter function from agentic-flow/reasoningbank to add memory capabilities to any agent.

faq.question: Is my data stored securely?
faq.answer: AgentDB stores data locally in SQLite database files. No data is transmitted to external servers by default.

faq.question: Why are searches slow?
faq.answer: Enable HNSW indexing and caching. Run npx agentdb@latest stats to check database configuration and optimize.

faq.question: How does this compare to ReasoningBank?
faq.answer: AgentDB is 150x faster with 100% API compatibility. Includes migration tools for existing ReasoningBank installations.
